name: ProShares Short 20+ Year Treasury
description: ProShares Short 20+ Year Treasury (TBF) is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that seeks to provide inverse exposure to the performance of the 20+ year U.S. Treasury bond market. Launched in 2012, TBF is designed for investors who anticipate rising interest rates and want to hedge against the potential decline in the value of long-term Treasury bonds. The fund achieves its objective by using financial derivatives to provide a return that is -1x the return of the ICE U.S. Treasury 20+ Year Bond Index, which consists of U.S. Treasury bonds with maturities of 20 years or more. As interest rates rise, bond prices typically fall, making TBF an attractive option for investors looking to profit from this inverse relationship. The fund is particularly appealing to fixed-income investors and portfolio managers who want to manage interest rate risk or speculate on future market movements. TBF is managed by ProShares, a leading provider of ETFs, known for its innovative products and strategies. The fund is traded on the New York Stock Exchange and provides liquidity and transparency typical of publicly traded securities, making it accessible for a wide range of investors. TBF is part of a broader category of inverse bond ETFs that allow market participants to express their views on interest rates and bond market dynamics.
